https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/routers/avc-control.html

AVC uses stateful deep packet inspection (DPI) to classify more than 1400 applications. It can also combine DPI with techniques such as statistical classification, socket caching, service discovery, auto learning, and DNS-AS. Custom applications can detect native apps.

That's error in Cisco documentation and question as well then, TCP, UDP are L4 protocols.
So, A, B, E are valid.
Error is in parenthesis , There shall be Layer 3 protocol type (ICMP, IPv4, IGMP, ...), TCP, UDP invalid statement ... so, yes A&E

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: AE
The Cisco definition is as below. In this list, there is no Layer 4 field:
NetFlow is based on 7 key fields 
 • Source IP address 
 • Destination IP address 
 • Source port number 
 • Destination port number 
 • Layer 3 protocol type (ex. TCP, UDP) 
 • ToS (type of service) byte 
 • Input logical interface 
If one field is different, a new flow is created in the flow cache.

comments.content: Agree with your answer, but thought TCP and UDP are Layer 4 protocols

discussion.content:
A. destination port
B. Type of Service byte

Both fields are commonly used for network traffic analysis and are relevant for monitoring, troubleshooting, and security purposes. The destination port is used to identify the specific application or service that the traffic is destined for, while the ToS byte is used to indicate the priority of a packet and differentiate between different types of network traffic.

Selected Answer: AE
A,E is correct
